definition[0]: to have a particular opinion about or understanding of something or someone
example[0]: I didn’t know what to make of her.
example[1]: What do you make of the idea?
definition[1]: to use the opportunities that you have in order to become successful
example[2]: I want to make something of my life.
example[3]: She has the ambition and talent to make something of herself.
definition[2]: to get as much advantage as you can from a situation while you are able to
example[4]: We’ve only got one day in Paris, so we’d better make the most of it.
definition[3]: to treat something as if it is more important than it really is
example[5]: It would be a mistake to make too much of these findings.
definition[4]: to spend a whole day, night etc doing something, because you have chosen to
example[6]: We decided to take a picnic and make a day of it.
